CONTRACTING_BODY.CA_ACTIVITY_OTHER: Defense of Human Rights, Democracy and the Rule of Law

TITLE.P: Acquisition of an IT application (design, development and deployment) and the associated maintenance and training services for the management of DCEP activities

SHORT_DESCR.P: This call for tenders concerns the acquisition of an IT application (design, development and deployment) and the associated maintenance and training services for the management of DCEP activities.
This tendering procedure is a competitive dialogue divided into 4 main stages:

Stage 1: The Contracting Authority shall draw up a provisional shortlist of minimum two candidates whose bids best respond to the eligibility and award criteria. These candidates shall be invited to take part in the dialogue and discuss all aspects of the contract in order to define the means required to best meet their needs.

Stage 2: Dialogue: All the aspects of the bid of the candidate shall be discussed during the hearings (scheduled approximately within the first 2 weeks of September 2018. Additional meetings may be scheduled before the end of 2018).
Stage 3: Submission of final bids by candidates.
Stage 4: Selection of the successful candidate by the Contracting Authority.
This call for tenders concerns the acquisition of an IT application (design, development and deployment) and the associated maintenance and training services for the management of DCEP activities.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The provisional start date of the contract is February 2019.
The definitive reception date of the IT application is foreseen within 1 year after the notification date to the contractor.
Maintenance services: the contract will be effective after the definitive acceptance of the IT application and after the warranty period is over,tacitly renewable 5 times, for periods of 12 months.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: There is one option foreseen which is: the secure space for applicants (section 11.2.3.2 of the Technical Specifications).

INFO_ADD.P: To obtain the procurement documents, the candidates must request them by email from the following address:purchasing@edqm.eu
Candidates shall be excluded if:

I. they are in the process of being tried or have been convicted in a final judgement on one or more of the following grounds: involvement in a criminal organisation, corruption, fraud or money laundering;

II. they are in a state of bankruptcy, liquidation, cessation of activities or judicial settlement or in a preventive scheme of arrangement with creditors or any other similar situation resulting from a procedure of the same nature, or are the subject of a procedure of the same nature;
III. have been the subject of a judgment constituting res judicata for an offence concerning their professional conduct or serious professional misconduct;

IV. have not fulfilled their obligations relating to the payment of social security contributions or taxes or other duties, pursuant to the legal provisions of the country in which they are established.
When submitting their bid, each tenderer shall provide a sworn statement attesting to the fact that none of the aforementioned situations apply to them.
The Council of Europe reserves the right to ask the successful tenderer to provide the following supporting documents:

1. for points under a), b) and c) above, a criminal record listing excerpt or, where this is not possible, an equivalent attestation issued by the competent judicial or administrative authorities of the country of incorporation of the tenderer, proving that these requirements are satisfied;
2. for points under d) a certificate issued by the competent authorities of the country of incorporation of the tenderer.
To obtain the procurement documents, the candidates must request them by email from the following address:purchasing@edqm.eu
The bids shall be sent by registered letter with acknowledgement of receipt to the following address:
council of Europe.
Palais de l’Europe – Service du Courrier.
For the attention of the Tenders board.
"2018-AO-19-Do not open".
Avenue de l’Europe.
F-67075 Strasbourg
Bids received after the deadline stipulated in these tendering rules and bids in unmarked envelopes will not be accepted.
The time-limit for receiving bids is 4.00 pm on 31.5.2018.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: See Rule 1333 of 29.6.2011 on the procurement procedures of the Council of Europe.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_INFO.OFFICIALNAME: See Rule 1333 of 29.6.2011 on the procurement procedures of the Council of Europe.
